events.name: Android and iOS Development: In war and in harmony

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
Google Developers Group Cyprus in collaboration with HackCyprus and the support of KIOS Research and Innovation Centre of Excellence are hosting a tech talk about â€œAndroid and iOS Development: In war and in harmonyâ€, by Silouanos Nicolaou.

In this presentation, Silouanos will try to compare the two main mobile platforms; iOS and Android, and how they are used to build the user interface (UI). The presentation will focus on the differences in building the UI and the learning curve for each platform. Silouanos will then demonstrate good and bad practices often followed in each platform.

In the second part of this presentation, Silouanos will talk about how a programmer can utilise the new Android's programming language, Kotlin, to build shared code for the two platforms.

18:00 Doors Open
18:30 Talk starts
19:30 Meet & Greet

p.s. Beers and Pizzas will be provided

events.how_to_find_us: Panepistimioupoli, Building 7, Room 010 (This is the same building as Nero caffe, in ground floor)

events.name: GDG Cyprus Christmas Drinkabout
events.description:
The new year is just around the corner and we are feeling festive!

After our first android meetup last week, we'd like to run something more casual, something to celebrate the start of GDG Cyprus, the end of 2018 and the start of 2019! We'd love to meet you and have a drink together!

Come, join us this Sunday at Moondogs bar, Nicosia, for a chat and a drink. We'd love to pay for your drinks, but we are a newborn GDG with no sponsorship; so bring your wallet for your own consumption.

events.name: GDG Cyprus New Year's Drinkabout
events.description:
2019 is here!

We are running a Christmas drinkabout in Nicosia, so we've decided to run a New Year's drinkabout in Limassol!

Come, join us on Saturday - location in Limassol to be decided - for a chat and a drink. We'd love to pay for your drinks, but we are a newborn GDG with no sponsorship; so bring your wallet for your own consumption.

events.name: Workshop: Designing for wicked problems

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
The Google Developers Group Cyprus presents the workshop:

â€Designing for wicked problemsâ€œ
by Panayotis Tzinis.

ğŸ“Evening schedule ğŸ“

18:30 Open for arrival
18:50 Welcome to GDG Cyprus meetup
19:00 Workshop
20:30 Social, food and drinks

Panayotis (AKA Darth), is the Intelligence Tech Lead of the X | Lab and a Google Developer Expert on Product Design, focusing on AI and Human Interface behavior and is a Google Developer Expert Sprint Master.
Throughout this workshop we will intro "wicked problems", what they are, how to address them and how to "try" to solve them without creating others! That's wicked!
At the Lab Exercise attendees will do some hands-on design/sketching, discussion and ideation.
It is a process inspired by Google UX leads in order for everybody to start design thinking and try to overcome barriers of their comfy zone.
It is addressed to everybody, there is no need for bringing a laptop with you, although you should bring a notepad and a pen!
After the workshop there will be time for networking and sharing of ideas!
Google will sponsor our Pizzas and Drinks!

For directions in finding the exact building and room, feel free to use this website: https://goo.gl/E4ENfi
events.how_to_find_us:
University of Cyprus - Nicosia
OED 01 Building 1st Floor, Room 130

events.name: HashCode Competition

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
Location: University Of Cyprus

Computer Society Cyprus is hosting Hashcode competition like every year.

Googleâ€™s team-based programming competition, Hash Code, allows you to share your skills and connect with other coders as you work together to solve a problem modeled off a real Google engineering challenge! In small teams of two to four, coders all over the world will tackle the first problem through an Online Qualification Round. Though this round is hosted online, teams can come together to compete side-by-side in locally coordinated Hash Code hubs. The top teams from this round are invited to join us at an international Google office for our annual Hash Code Final Round.

events.name: Docker containers and Orchestration

venue.name: Cyprus University of Technology, Tassos Papadopoulos Building

events.description:
In this talk there will be an introduction to what Docker is, what made it special and why it has gotten to be so popular.
Additionally a demonstration will take place showing how one can containerize an application and how to deploy it on the cloud as a container.
Lastly a presentation about Rancher and Kubernetes will conclude the talk demonstrating how to orchestrate containers and form them in clusters.

Speakers:
Valentinos Papasavvas is a Lead developer in Mindgeek where he is in charge of one of the biggest and high traffic products of Mindgeek. He studied Computer Science in Crete/Heraklion and did a Master in Sheffield. He worked for 5 years as a Web Developer in the UK at a small Digital Agency company which was a growth experience for him and also worked in one of the biggest online retailers of short dated and residual stock food, by optimizing the internal web application that was responsible for order packing and picking. He is part of the Hack Cyprus board.

Andreas Lefkatis graduated from University of Sheffield and University of Kent with an MComp and MSc. He has worked for several companies in London and Cyprus and he is now a Senior Software Engineer at NCR. Andreas is also a founding member of GDG Cyprus and a member of the Hack Cyprus board.

events.name: Hack{Cyprus} 2019 Hackathon - The comeback
events.description:
The Hack{Cyprus} flagship event is back with a twist!
This year your favorite Hackathon will be hosted under the umbrella of LEAD Cyprus and after your demand it will take place simultaneously in six different cities: Larnaca, Nicosia, Limassol, Kyrenia, Famagusta and Paphos!

Get your ticket now https://is.gd/2tupoW and Join 250+ creative coders, designers and ideators for 43 hours of hacking awesomeness in your preferred city.

We'll provide food, drinks and internet â€“ mix in some creativity and skills to turn your ideas in bytes and pixels! Top competitors will be awarded and fun swag will be given to all participants!

How to attend the Hack{Cyprus} 2019 Hackathon:
1. Form a team and find an idea
2. Decide the city you will attend Hack{Cyprus} 2019
3. The space is limited! Register on https://is.gd/2tupoW.
One ticket = One person! Make sure that all your team members have a ticket!
4. Show up and have fun!

You can design, sketch and conceptualise beforehand, but all code must be fresh - web, mobile, robots, hardware, algorithms, anything goes. Your team must be a maximum of 5 people. You will have full ownership & IP of whatever you build.

For more info visit: http://comeback.hackcyprus.com/

Still have questions?
Email [masked]

events.name: GDG CYPRUS PRESENTS: Two talks at High Tech Cyprus ğŸ‰
events.description:
This coming Saturday GDG Cyprus is joining High Tech Cyprus, a one-day free summit, for tech professionals who want to make the most out of their careers in the island.

We are running two 20-minute talks during this day, among other amazing talks given by other teams.

~~~
15:20 - 15:40 GDG Cyprus presents: How to become a resourceful and invaluable engineer in your team

"Being a great programmer" does not help you stand out from the crowd. This is a talk of how tech professionals can arm themselves with tools, good practices and the right attitude to be resourceful for the team and invaluable for their company!
~~~
15:40 - 16:00 GDG Cyprus presents: Connecting with tech professionals beyond your daily job in Cyprus

Cyprus is a small island, they say. There are few opportunities, they say. This is a talk about finding opportunities and creating opportunities. We will showcase all the tech communities and initiatives happening in Cyprus at the moment, and ways anyone can get involved; from a participant to a high-contributing volunteer and co-organiser.
~~~

Full Agenda and Reserving your free ticket: https://www.hightechcyprus.com/

events.name: Infrastructure IS Code - Intro to AWS CDK

venue.name: Î Î±Î½ÎµÏ€Î¹ÏƒÏ„Î®Î¼Î¹Î¿ ÎšÏÏ€ÏÎ¿Ï… University of Cyprus

events.description:
In this tech-talk we are delighted to have with us Dr. Michael Mourao, Full Stack Developer at Nodes & Links and Vasos Koupparis, also a Full Stack Developer at Nodes & Links.

AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) became publicly available in July 2019, but it's already proving to be a juggernaut in the area of Infrastructure as Code (IaC), allowing developers to use their favourite programming language (TypeScript, Python, C#, Java are currently available), to provision cloud resources without having to worry about templates or learning custom-made languages. Furthermore, it provides concise and easy-to-use defaults, that have been optimised in terms of security and performance. We will demonstrate its use to build and deploy a serverless API, and get a glimpse of its full potential by showing how we used it for the deployment of multiple production and dev environments at Nodes & Links.

Agenda:

18:30 - Tech Talk Starts
20:00 - Q&A
20:30 - Drinks & Pizza

About the Speakers:
Dr. Michael Mourao is a mathematician turned software developer, with a doctorate in Mathematics from Warwick University (UK) and a Masters from Cambridge University (UK). He has over 6 years of experience in delivering enterprise-level, cloud-based applications to international organisations.
Vasos Koupparis is a software developer with a bachelor in Computer Science from the University of Surrey (UK). He has over 5 years of experience in web application development and architecting solutions on cloud services for both individuals and enterprises.

Structure of the talk:
1. What is AWS CDK?
2. Demo:
2.1. Create a DynamoDB database table
2.2. Create a Lambda function and an api endpoint to write to the table
2.3. Deploy our application
2.4. Create Fargate cluster and a docker task that runs when triggered by another Lambda function
2.5. Redeploy the application
3. How we used AWS CDK at Nodes & Links to provision as many environments as we want using the same code
3.1 20+ interdependent stacks for each environment
3.2 Temporary cloud environments for feature development
3.3 Tagging is easy!
4. Conclusion

Terminology Cheat-Sheet:
https://bit.ly/2OP9Sxl

events.name: GDG Cyprus Christmas Limassol Drinkabout
events.description:
The new year is just around the corner and we are feeling festive!

We are extremely happy that through our meetups we have managed to bring together so many developers from all over Cyprus. To wrap up this amazing year we'd like to run something more casual, so that we can celebrate all the amazing people we've met and meet some more! To celebrate together the end of 2019 and the start of 2020! We'd love to meet you and have a drink together!

Join us on the 17th December at Lab restaurant and bar in Limassol, for a chat and a drink. We'd love to pay for your drinks, but we are running GDG with no sponsorship; so bring your amazing energy and your wallet for your own consumption.

events.name: Infrastructure IS Code - Intro to AWS CDK

venue.name: Cyprus University of Technology, Tassos Papadopoulos Building

events.description:
GDG Cyprus is happy to announce that the tech talk "AWS infrastructure IS code" will be presented for second time after a very successful event in Nicosia, this time in Limassol.

In this tech-talk we are delighted to have with us Dr. Michael Mourao, Full Stack Developer at Nodes & Links and Vasos Koupparis, also a Full Stack Developer at Nodes & Links.

AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) became publicly available in July 2019, but it's already proving to be a juggernaut in the area of Infrastructure as Code (IaC), allowing developers to use their favourite programming language (TypeScript, Python, C#, Java are currently available), to provision cloud resources without having to worry about templates or learning custom-made languages. Furthermore, it provides concise and easy-to-use defaults, that have been optimised in terms of security and performance. We will demonstrate its use to build and deploy a serverless API, and get a glimpse of its full potential by showing how we used it for the deployment of multiple production and dev environments at Nodes & Links.

Agenda:

19:00 - Infrastructure is Code - Intro to AWS CDK
20:30 - Q&A
21:00 - Networking

About the Speakers:
Dr. Michael Mourao is a mathematician turned software developer, with a doctorate in Mathematics from Warwick University (UK) and a Masters from Cambridge University (UK). He has over 6 years of experience in delivering enterprise-level, cloud-based applications to international organisations.
Vasos Koupparis is a software developer with a bachelor in Computer Science from the University of Surrey (UK). He has over 5 years of experience in web application development and architecting solutions on cloud services for both individuals and enterprises.

Structure of the talk:
1. What is AWS CDK?
2. Demo:
2.1. Create a DynamoDB database table
2.2. Create a Lambda function and an api endpoint to write to the table
2.3. Deploy our application
2.4. Create Fargate cluster and a docker task that runs when triggered by another Lambda function
2.5. Redeploy the application
3. How we used AWS CDK at Nodes & Links to provision as many environments as we want using the same code
3.1 20+ interdependent stacks for each environment
3.2 Temporary cloud environments for feature development
3.3 Tagging is easy!
4. Conclusion

Terminology Cheat-Sheet:
https://bit.ly/2OP9Sxl

events.name: Women Techmakers Cyprus kick off meeting
events.description:
Women Techmakers Cyprus has been instantiated by 2 ambassadors of the global Women Techmakers community that are passionate about technology and would love to provide resources and help to the local community. The purpose of the community is to connect, empower and encourage each and every single woman in tech to understand and pursue her passion in any technology related field. How will we do that? Through inspiring stories, learn hands-on via design sprints and codelabs, meetups, mentoring, confident workshops etc.

During this talk we'll be kicking off Women Techmakers Cyprus! Whether you are a student, currently looking for a job, in your early career stage, or just interested in technology, this event is for you! We'll tell you all about our plans on how we want to help women in tech grow!

Agenda:

18:30 - Introduction to Women Techmakers Cyprus talk starts
20:00 - Q&A
20:30 - Networking

About the Speakers:
Galatia Partheniou has studied Computer Science at the University of Sheffield and acquired her MSc in Mobile Application Development at the University of Kent. With her great passion for android development, she currently has over 4 years of experience in developing native apps for the platform. She has worked in London, United Kingdom for a few startups before moving back to Cyprus where she currently works as a Senior Android Developer at BDSwiss in Limassol. The passion she has for development and learning led her to become an organising member of the GDG Cyprus community and continues to grow her volunteering activities to help the developers community as much as possible.

Melpo Pittara is currently a scientist specialist of the Department of Computer Science at University of Cyprus focusing on matters of eHealth, Machine Learning and Virtual Reality. At the same time, she is a PhD Candidate of the Department of Bernoulli Institute for Mathematics, Computer Science and Artificial Intelligent at University of Groningen. She is a graduate of the University of Cyprus holding a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering and a Master of Science in Electrical Engineering with specialization in Biomedical Engineering. During her University time she received various honours for her strong presence, the bright prospect in the community and the various volunteering initiatives, who continuous until now.

events.name: HackTheCrisisCyprus - Digital Hackathon
events.description:
RISE, the Research and Innovation Center of Excellence and Cypriot Enterprise Link's hack{cyprus} hackathons are co-organizing the #HackTheCrisisCyprus online hackathon (Hack-From-Home) on April[masked].

HackTheCrisisCyprus is organized under the auspices of the Digital Champion of Cyprus, Dr Stelios Chimonas and the support of numerous community partners and sponsors.

The aim of the hackathon is to find solutions to problems created by the novel coronavirus pandemic. We want to give people the opportunity to apply their skills, knowledge, experience, and talents to propose solutions to the problems faced by small and large businesses, citizens, the government, local authorities, and others. We also aim to give the people of Cyprus the opportunity to raise issues and problems that they encounter in their day-to-day activities in this unprecedented situation.

The idea for HackTheCrisisCyprus, was inspired by the example of Estonia, which we have followed as a model to organize our â€œHack The Crisisâ€ initiative. At the moment, there are many similar hackathons taking place around the world with great success in countries such as Germany, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia, Italy, Canada, Australia, Brazil and many more. Many amazing and applicable ideas have been developed at these hackathons to provide solutions to problems varying from, inventing alternative protective masks for hospitals, to helping businesses with cash-flow issues, to finding innovative ways for people needing help to connect with people that can provide it, and many more.

We invite everyone to contribute to our effort to find solutions that might help improve the conditions caused by the pandemic.

Free Registration: https://bit.ly/2xuoKLm

HOW TO PARTICIPATE

âœ”ï¸ Website: https://hackthecrisis.hackcyprus.com
âœ”ï¸ Team size <= 5 people - Yes, 1 person teams are allowed.
âœ”ï¸Bring your idea and any code you have from before.
âœ”ï¸Stay home and collaborate remotely with your teammates.
âœ”ï¸You can use any technology (hardware or software) along with any programming language.
âœ”ï¸University students are welcome.
âœ”ï¸You will have full ownership & IP of whatever you build.
âœ”ï¸You can design, sketch and conceptualise and write code beforehand.
âœ”ï¸Your project needs to tackle an issue related to the crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic in Cyprus or worldwide.
âœ”ï¸Unacceptable behavior as described in the code of conduct will not be tolerated and the person will be removed from all channels and social media related to the event.
âœ”ï¸To submit your project, you must provide a GitHub repository link, a PDF presentation, if possible access to your working demo and a one minute video that demonstrates your implemented idea (e.g. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=azep6YQy2Io).

For more details, registration to the hackathon, ways to contribute to this cause and general communication, please visit: http://hackthecrisis.hackcyprus.com/

Still have questions? Email us on: [masked]

events.name: Live Session: The Switch to Remote Schools Amidst the Pandemic
events.description:
We are excited to have Christina Shailas with us for a session around remote schools and remote teaching. A subject that is very much of interest to anyone and everyone amidst the coronavirus pandemic. A great opportunity for everyone to think of and implement alternative ways of teaching.

Due to the lockdown measures, education systems around the world were forced into remote teaching and learning in order to ensure the continuation of educating our youth. Some schools were better prepared than others with the platforms already in place. Other schools had to address getting their teachers and students the basics before they could even consider operating in this way. No matter what level of readiness, school administrations, teachers, students and parents entered the virtual classroom without fully knowing what to expect. Christina Shailas, Educational Technologist at The Heritage Private School in Limassol, has joined us to share her experiences throughout this journey so far.

A few words about Christina Shailas
Christina Shailas is a first-generation Cypriot and Constantinople-Greek, born and raised in New York York City. Christina completed her undergraduate degree at New York University where she majored in Mathematics and Political Science. She went on to Columbia University to complete her Masters degree in Mathematics Education. Christina worked as a Mathematics Teacher and Technology Integrationist at Convent of the Sacred Heart, a prestigious independent school in Upper East Side, Manhattan. She implemented a school-wide paperless classroom through a 1-1 iPad program and worked closely with faculty/students to integrate technology into classroom organization, instruction and projects. In addition, Christina developed a makers lab and curriculum where students worked with 3D printers, robotics, circuitry, programming and virtual reality. Extremely passionate about designing curricula that fosters a love for lifelong learning, Christina integrated technology into design-thinking activities as a way to encourage problem solving, critical thinking and resilience in her students. She has immense knowledge in Google for Education and Microsoft Education, as well as experience in onboarding schools to these platforms. Last year, Christina joined The Heritage Private School in Limassol, Cyprus with the purpose of continuing her roles as a technology integrationist and assisting to develop the school's educational technology program. Christina also serves as the Cyprus Liaison to the Cyprus-U.S. Chamber of Commerce.

The link of the session will be provided on the day of the event.

PS: If you have any questions, feel free to email them at [masked] and we will answer them during our live session.
